alert.note: Alert for Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 7:51PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following county, Martin. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 749 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding of roads across the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain fell today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shoals and Lacy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
